result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Steltenpohl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the Walworth County Drug Court Program WITH NO VIOLATIONS, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
-----------------------------

The Defendant is a participant in the Walworth County Drug Court Program and must comply with all the rules and regulations of the Program with no violations.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, the defendant must serve five (5) days in the Walworth County Jail without Work Release to commence immediately after sentencing. The Court STAYS one year of the conditional release jail time to be used at Court's discretion.

supervisions.notes: **12/18/2017 AMENDMENT:  JOC has been AMENDED to reflect defendant's correct sentence credit to be 188 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain full time employment or full time school or a combination of the two.
-----------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs. No prescription drugs unless with a valid prescription and must be taken in accordance with the terms of the prescription. Not to possess drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
-----------------------------------

Follow through with any treatment that he may start while in prison.  Comply with any assessment or counseling as recommended by Agent.
-----------------------------------

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for William J Steltenpohl
Current: PO Box 950 -#551600, c/o Columbia correctional Institution, Portage, WI 53901 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2017)
Prior: 516 Haskins Street, Lake Geneva, WI 53147
Temporary Commitment form filed

3:32 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant William J Steltenpohl in court, in custody with Atty Stephen M Compton.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing after revocation hearing.  Court recites charge and maximum potential penalties.  Defendant has been terminated from drug treatment court.  Court has reviewed the revocation summary and warrant as well as the Court file.  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record as to compliance with victims rights.  Atty Compton has reviewed the revocation summary and warrant with his client.  
3:35 pm  Statement by defendant's mother, Diane Steltenpohl.  
3:40 pm  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record with regard to an ordinance drug offense back in 2003.  Judge Drettwan was the prosecutor on that case.  Atty Wiedenfeld e-mailed the Court and Atty Compton as to this case.  Court has no memory of that case.  Atty Compton has no objection to the Court remaining on the current case.  
3:41 pm  Argument as to sentence by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
4:13 pm  Statement by Mr. Steltenpohl.  
4:15 pm  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

SENTENCE:
Total length of sentence:  3 yrs, 6 mths prison;  
Initial Confinement:  18 months
Extended Supervision:  2 years
140 days of sentence credit
ELIGIBLE for both CIP and SAP

CONDITIONS OF ES:
1)  Not to possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs.  No prescription drugs unless with a valid prescription and must be taken in accordance with the terms of the prescription.  Not to possess drug paraphernalia.  
2)  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  
3)  Maintain full time employment or full time school or a combination of the two.  
4)  Follow through with any treatment that he may start while in prison.  
5)  Comply with any assessment or counseling as recommended by Agent.  

Court gives warnings:  1)  May not possess firearms;  2)  May not vote until civil rights are restored.  
4:35 pm  Court in recess.

BOND TOTAL ALL FILES: 2014CF000373, 2014CT000263, AND 2014CT000264. MUST POST $500.00 CASH.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): J.S.
